text: (upbeat music)
- Hi everybody.
How are you doing?

Today, let's make some
summer side dish made with

perilla leaves, you
know about these leaves?
Perilla leaves, these days, it's very peak season.

If you follow my recipe for
years, probably you know that.

Actually, around almost ten
years ago when I made

perilla leaves recipes,
actually at the time

not many people knew about
these leaves. (laughs)
But in Korean cuisine,
everybody loves these perilla leaves.
In Korean, Kkaennip, this is a new recipe,
I have never made this before.

It is Kkaennipjjim,
jjim means "steamed".
So steamed perilla leaves.
It's really, really a good side dish,
especially during the summertime,

keep it in the refrigerator
for up to one week
and then you can eat just with rice

all the time,  you take
it out and then eat.
So it's a kind of Mitbanchan.
Perilla leaves are little minty

so when it's cooked it
will give herby flavor.
I'm growing my perilla leaves.
I'm going to show you my little garden,
tiny, tiny, little garden.
We need 60, 60 perilla leaves.
26 perilla leaves are here, I need 34 more
so I can make 60 perilla leaves
and then make a nice side dish!
You want to follow me?
Let's go together.
(upbeat music)

All I need is these guys,
let's go to make kkaennipjjim!

My perilla leaves make
me so happy these days.
All during the summertime, every morning,

I just go and see, so
small thing makes your life
really, really happy, isn't it?

All together, 60, nice,
nice, gorgeous, pretty!
Now we gotta wash these.

I will show you how to
wash perilla leaves.
Wash.
Each leaf,  between the leaves,

just a little bit of rubbing
like this and wash.

Homegrown perilla
leaves are very clean.

I don't have to really wash a
lot but still, we gotta wash.
One more time, three times wash.
Now we gotta make some seasoning sauce.
Seasoning sauce, what should I use first?
Garlic, garlic, two cloves of garlic.
Mince this.
And two green onions.
An onion.
I'm using a lot of onion, around one cup.

For 60 perilla leaves, I will
add two tablespoons soy sauce
and fish sauce, one tablespoon.

If you are vegetarian,
just skip the fish sauce and

add 3 tablespoon soy sauce
instead of 2 tablespoons.
Hot pepper flakes, two teaspoons.
Sesame oil, one tablespoon.
Sesame seeds,  one tablespoon is enough
and then three tablespoons water.
What do you think this tastes like?
Yummy.

I just mixed this, then
what I'm going to do is,

this is my shallow small pan
 I will just add these.
About half amount and put it here.
From the bottom, bottom two,

put it here, just a little
bit, around one teaspoon,
like this and two more leaves.
It doesn't have to be really evenly spread
because it's going to be cooked anyway.
Before put these,  quickly let's just
organize one more time.
This way.
See, from here, we start again.
Sauce.
Now this is nice, gorgeous, isn't it?
Every other leaf is just filled
with nice, delicious seasoning.
Let's cook!

Over medium high heat,
three minutes, cook.
Three minutes passed. Turn off

I'm making my doenjang-jjigae.

Three minute passed. Let's see!
Wow!  gorgeous looking kkaennipjjim!
I cooked 3 minutes over medium high heat with cover
and then turned off and let it cook
with the heat, 3 minutes.
Three, three policy! (laughs)

This is my airtight container
and put this in here.
We didn't add any sugar here
because I used a lot of onion, chopped onion. Onion makes it so sweet.

When it's cooled down, cover
and keep in the refrigerator.

if it's too sunny,
